TITLE: Plugin Source URL definition
DESCRIPTION: Defines the source URL for a Stash plugin, pointing to the index.yml file where the plugin metadata is located. This URL is used by Stash to fetch the plugin information and install it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/plugins/list.md#_snippet_107

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
https://feederbox826.github.io/plugins/main/index.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GraphQL Query using curl with API Key
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to execute a GraphQL query against the Stash API using curl and an API Key for authentication.
It requires replacing `<your_api_key>` with the actual API Key and `<graphql_query>` with the raw GraphQL query string. The request is sent to the `/graphql` endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/api.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X POST -H "ApiKey: <your_api_key>" -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{ "query": "<graphql_query>" }' localhost:9999/graphql
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Source URL for Hot Cards plugin
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the source URL for the `Hot Cards` Stash plugin. This URL provides Stash with the location of the plugin's index file, enabling installation and updates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/plugins/list.md#_snippet_40

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
https://stashapp.github.io/CommunityScripts/stable/index.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create Stash service file
DESCRIPTION: This code block shows how to create a systemd service file for Stash. It configures the service to run Stash at startup, sets the working directory, user, and execution command.  It defines that the service should restart on failure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/synology.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
[Unit]
Description=Run Stash at startup
After=network.target

[Service]
WorkingDirectory=/var/services/homes/stash
Type=simple
User=stash
ExecStart=/bin/bash -c -l '\
   exec ./stash-linux'
Restart=on-failure

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Inspecting Video Files with ffprobe
DESCRIPTION: This command uses ffprobe to display format and stream information about a video file. This information can be useful for debugging playback issues or when reporting bugs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/troubleshooting-video-playback.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
ffprobe -show_format -show_streams big_buck_bunny.mkv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: performers.gql mutation
DESCRIPTION: This GraphQL mutation creates a new performer with various attributes. It is intended to be used with gql-iterate for importing performer data from a CSV file.  The mutation takes performer details such as name, URL, gender, birthdate, and image URL as input and returns the ID of the newly created performer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/importing-via-csv-using-gql-iterate.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: graphql
CODE:
```
mutation PerformerCreate( 
  $name: String!, 
  $url: String, 
  $gender: GenderEnum, 
  $birthdate: String, 
  $ethnicity: String, 
  $country: String, 
  $eye_color: String, 
  $height: String, 
  $measurements: String, 
  $fake_tits: String, 
  $career_length: String, 
  $tattoos: String, 
  $piercings: String, 
  $aliases: String, 
  $twitter: String, 
  $instagram: String, 
  $favorite: Boolean, 
  $image: String) {
       performerCreate(input: { 
         name: $name, 
         url: $url, 
         gender: $gender, 
         birthdate: $birthdate, 
         ethnicity: $ethnicity, 
         country: $country, 
         eye_color: $eye_color, 
         height: $height, 
         measurements: $measurements, 
         fake_tits: $fake_tits, 
         career_length: $career_length, 
         tattoos: $tattoos,
         piercings: $piercings, 
         aliases: $aliases, 
         twitter: $twitter, 
         instagram: $instagram, 
         favorite: $favorite, 
         image: $image }
   ) 
   { id } 
 }
```

TITLE: Source URL - Stash Performer Image Cropper (YAML)
DESCRIPTION: Defines the source URL for the Stash Performer Image Cropper plugin. Stash uses this URL to download the plugin's metadata and installation instructions, which are stored in a YAML file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/plugins/list.md#_snippet_80

```

TITLE: Install Python scraper/plugin requirements
DESCRIPTION: These commands install the Python requirements for Stash scrapers and plugins. `pipreqs .stash/.` generates a requirements.txt file based on the dependencies found in the .stash directory.  Then, `pip3 install -r .stash/requirements.txt` installs those dependencies within the active python environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/synology.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pipreqs .stash/.
pip3 install -r .stash/requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: tags.gql mutation
DESCRIPTION: This GraphQL mutation creates a new tag with a name and an optional image URL.  It's designed to be used with gql-iterate to import tag data from a CSV file. The mutation takes the tag's name and image URL as input and returns the ID of the newly created tag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/importing-via-csv-using-gql-iterate.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: graphql
CODE:
```
mutation TagCreate( 
  $name: String!,
  $image: String) {
    tagCreate(input: { 
      name: $name,  
      image: $image 
    }) {
   id
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Apache Reverse Proxy Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures Apache as a reverse proxy for Stash, including support for WebSockets. It also includes SSL configuration and sets the necessary headers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/reverse-proxy.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: apache
CODE:
```
# if using apache < 2.4.47, remove upgrade=websocket
ProxyPass "/stash" "http://127.0.0.1:9999" upgrade=websocket
ProxyPassReverse "/stash" "http://127.0.0.1:9999"
RequestHeader setIfEmpty X-Forwarded-Prefix "/stash"
ProxyPreserveHost on

# for name resolution
ServerAdmin admin@example.com
ServerName example.com
ServerAlias stash.example.com

# to enable websockets for apache < 2.4.47
#RewriteEngine on
#RewriteCond %{HTTP:Upgrade} websocket [NC]
#RewriteCond %{HTTP:Connection} upgrade [NC]
#RewriteRule ^/?stash/(.*) "ws://127.0.0.1:9999/$1" [P,L]

# to add SSL
SSLEngine on
SSLCertificateFile /path/to/cert.pem
SSLCertificateKeyFile /path/to/cert.key
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Nginx Reverse Proxy Configuration with URL Prefix
DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures Nginx to reverse proxy to Stash under a specific URL prefix.  It's important to include a trailing slash in the `proxy_pass` directive to ensure the prefix is removed from the request before being sent to Stash.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/reverse-proxy.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```
location /stash/ {
    # Notice the trailing slash - this causes nginx to remove the /stash prefix from requested URLs
    proxy_pass http://192.168.0.1:9999/;

    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "Upgrade";
    proxy_set_header Host $http_host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Port $server_port;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Prefix /stash;
    proxy_read_timeout 60000s;
}
```

TITLE: Display Tag Image With Tag Source URL
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides the source URL for the Display Tag Image With Tag plugin. This plugin enhances Stash UI by displaying the image of a tag above its name on any page with clickable tags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/plugins/list.md#_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: YAML

TITLE: Nginx Reverse Proxy with Docker (Linuxserver Letsencrypt)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides an Nginx configuration for use with the Linuxserver Letsencrypt Docker image, reverse proxying to Stash. It handles SSL configuration and sets necessary headers, including support for websockets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/reverse-proxy.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```
# make sure that your dns has a cname set for stash

server {
    listen 443 ssl;
    listen [::]:443 ssl;

    server_name stash.*;

    include /config/nginx/ssl.conf;

    client_max_body_size 0;

    # enable for ldap auth, fill in ldap details in ldap.conf
    #include /config/nginx/ldap.conf;

    location / {
        # enable the next two lines for http auth
        #auth_basic "Restricted";
        #auth_basic_user_file /config/nginx/.htpasswd;

        # enable the next two lines for ldap auth
        #auth_request /auth;
        #error_page 401 =200 /login;

        include /config/nginx/proxy.conf;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
        resolver 127.0.0.11 valid=30s;
        set $upstream_app stash;
        set $upstream_port 9999;
        set $upstream_proto http;
        proxy_pass $upstream_proto://$upstream_app:$upstream_port;
        proxy_set_header Host $http_host;
        proxy_read_timeout 60000s;
    }
}
```

TITLE: Remuxing Video Files with ffmpeg
DESCRIPTION: This command remuxes a video file into a new file without re-encoding the video or audio streams. This can sometimes resolve playback issues caused by container corruption or compatibility problems. It takes an input file and creates a remuxed version with the same codecs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/troubleshooting-video-playback.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
ffmpeg -i big_buck_bunny.mkv -c:v copy -c:a copy remuxed_file.mkv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Download Stash binary
DESCRIPTION: These commands download the latest version of Stash and its checksum file from GitHub releases. It uses `uname -m` to determine the system architecture and download the corresponding Stash binary. The checksum is then validated to ensure the integrity of the downloaded file before cleanup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/synology.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# find what architecture your synology is running on
uname -m

# depending on the architecture, you'll have to download the right version of stash

# x86_64
wget https://github.com/stashapp/stash/releases/latest/download/stash-linux
# armv6l
wget https://github.com/stashapp/stash/releases/latest/download/stash-linux-arm32v6
# armv7l
wget https://github.com/stashapp/stash/releases/latest/download/stash-linux-arm32v7
# aarch64
wget https://github.com/stashapp/stash/releases/latest/download/stash-linux-arm64v8

# Download the CHECKSUM
wget https://github.com/stashapp/stash/releases/latest/download/CHECKSUMS_SHA1

# Perform the checksum validation
sha1sum -c --ignore-missing CHECKSUMS_SHA1

# you should see a line that says `stash-linux: OK`
# if not, something went wrong during the download

# Clean up the now unnecessary file
rm CHECKSUMS_SHA1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enable and start Stash service
DESCRIPTION: These commands enable the Stash service to start on boot and starts the service immediately.  Sudo is required to manage systemd services.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/synology.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo systemctl enable "$(pwd)/stash.service"
sudo systemctl start stash.service
```

TITLE: GraphQL Query using curl with Legacy Cookies
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to authenticate and execute a GraphQL query against the Stash API using curl with legacy cookie authentication. It first authenticates with the server using username and password, storing the session cookie. Then uses the stored cookie to make the GraphQL request. Requires replacing `<graphql_query>` with the raw GraphQL query string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/api.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl --verbose --cookie-jar cookie.txt --data 'username=stash&password=**' localhost:9999/login
curl --cookie cookie.txt -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{ "query": "<graphql_query>" }' localhost:9999/graphql
```

TITLE: Extracting Video Sample with ffmpeg
DESCRIPTION: This command extracts a sample from a video file using ffmpeg. It starts at a specified time offset and extracts a specified duration. This is useful for providing developers with a small, representative sample of a video file for analysis. The `-ss` parameter specifies the starting point, and `-t` specifies the duration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/troubleshooting-video-playback.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
ffmpeg -ss 120 -i big_buck_bunny.mkv  -t 30 -c:v copy -c:a copy 30_second_sample.mkv
```

TITLE: Caddy v2 Reverse Proxy Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a Caddy v2 configuration for reverse proxying to Stash. It sets the necessary headers for the application to function correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/reverse-proxy.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: caddy
CODE:
```
stash.example.com {
    reverse_proxy 127.0.0.1:9999 {
        header_up Host {host}
        header_up X-Real-IP {remote_host}
        header_up X-Forwarded-Port {server_port}
    }
}
```

TITLE: Install FFmpeg - TrueNAS Core
DESCRIPTION: This command installs FFmpeg and FFprobe in the iocage jail, which are required for Stash to process media files. FFmpeg provides functionalities for encoding, decoding, and streaming audio and video.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/freenas-truenas.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
pkg install ffmpeg
```

TITLE: Nginx Reverse Proxy Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a basic Nginx configuration for reverse proxying to Stash. It sets the necessary headers to pass the client's IP address and protocol to the Stash application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/reverse-proxy.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```
location / {
    proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:9999;
    
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
    proxy_set_header Host $http_host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_read_timeout 60000s;
}
```

TITLE: Changing Stash file executable permissions
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to modify the executable permissions of the `stash-macos` file using the `chmod` command in a Unix-like environment. This ensures that the file can be executed as a program.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/macos.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
chmod u+x stash-macos
```

TITLE: Download Stash Binary - TrueNAS Core
DESCRIPTION: These commands download the `stash-linux` binary from GitHub, change its ownership to the `stash` user and group, and make it executable. Replace the version number with the latest release version from the GitHub repository. This ensures that the binary can be executed by the stash user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/freenas-truenas.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cd /usr/local/bin
fetch https://github.com/stashapp/stash/releases/download/v0.22.1/stash-linux
chown stash:stash stash-linux
chmod +x stash-linux
```

TITLE: rc.d Startup Script - TrueNAS Core
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines an rc.d startup script for Stash, allowing it to run as a daemon in the background and start automatically at boot. The script defines dependencies, user/group, configuration directory, and executable binary. It also includes functions for creating the PID file and running the daemon.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/freenas-truenas.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
#!/bin/sh

# PROVIDE: stash
# REQUIRE: DAEMON
# KEYWORD: shutdown


. /etc/rc.subr

name=stash
rcvar=stash_enable

load_rc_config $name

: ${stash_enable:="NO"}
: ${stash_user:="stash"}
: ${stash_group:="stash"}
: ${stash_config_dir:="/usr/local/etc/stash/config.yml"}
: ${stash_exec_bin:="/usr/local/bin/stash-linux"}

#daemon
pidfile="/var/run/${name}.pid"
command="/usr/sbin/daemon"
command_args="-f -P ${pidfile} ${stash_exec_bin} --config ${stash_config_dir}"
start_precmd="stash_precmd"

stash_precmd() {
    install -o ${stash_user} -g ${stash_group} /dev/null ${pidfile}
}

run_rc_command $1
```

TITLE: SQL Query to Update Folder Paths
DESCRIPTION: These SQL queries update the `path` column in the `folders` table to replace backslashes with forward slashes and replace a Windows drive path with a Unix-style mount point.  This is useful when migrating a Stash database from Windows to a Unix-like operating system, requiring manual adjustments to the file paths stored in the database.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/faq/setup.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
UPDATE folders SET path = REPLACE(path, '\\', '/');
UPDATE folders SET path = REPLACE(path, 'D:/', '/mnt/');
```

TITLE: Make Stash Binary Executable Linux
DESCRIPTION: This command makes the downloaded Stash binary executable. It is necessary to grant execute permissions before running the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/linux.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chmod u+x <binary-name>
```

TITLE: Create symbolic links for FFmpeg
DESCRIPTION: This snippet creates symbolic links for ffprobe and ffmpeg, pointing to the executables installed by the Ffmpeg 6 package. This ensures that Stash can find and use these tools. Sudo is required to create the symlinks in /usr/local/bin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/synology.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo ln -s /var/packages/ffmpeg6/target/bin/ffprobe /usr/local/bin/ffprobe
sudo ln -s /var/packages/ffmpeg6/target/bin/ffmpeg /usr/local/bin/ffmpeg
```

TITLE: Create User - TrueNAS Core
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a new user named `stash` with a specific user ID (1069) and sets the home directory to `/nonexistent`. It also configures the shell to `/usr/sbin/nologin` to prevent the user from logging in directly. This user will be used to run the Stash service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/freenas-truenas.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
pw useradd -n stash -u 1069 -d /nonexistent -s /usr/sbin/nologin
```

TITLE: Nginx Reverse Proxy with external_host setting
DESCRIPTION: An Nginx configuration utilizing the `external_host` configuration option in Stash. Assumes `stash.home` as the domain and forwards requests to Stash running on `192.168.0.1`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/reverse-proxy.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```
server {
    listen 80;
    listen [::]:80;

    server_name stash.home;
    client_max_body_size 0;

    location / {
        proxy_pass http://192.168.0.1:9999;

        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "Upgrade";
        proxy_set_header Host $http_host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Port $server_port;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    }
}
```

TITLE: Execute gql-iterate
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the gql-iterate tool to import data from a CSV file into a GraphQL endpoint. The command specifies the host, input CSV file, and GraphQL query file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/importing-via-csv-using-gql-iterate.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
gql-iterate --host http://_yourserverIP:portgoeshere_/graphql --input ./performerdata.csv --query ./performers.gql
```

TITLE: Configure NAS environment
DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the NAS environment by creating a .profile file in the user's home directory. This file sets the PATH variable to include /usr/local/bin and activates the stash-env virtual environment. This ensures that ffmpeg and python environment are available to stash.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/synology.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
echo 'PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH' > .profile
echo 'source stash-env/bin/activate' >> .profile
```

TITLE: Apache Modules Prerequisites
DESCRIPTION: These commands enable necessary Apache modules for reverse proxying, including proxy, HTTP proxy, balancer, load balancing methods, rewrite, headers, and SSL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/reverse-proxy.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo a2enmod proxy
sudo a2enmod proxy_http
sudo a2enmod proxy_balancer
sudo a2enmod lbmethod_byrequests

sudo a2enmod rewrite
sudo a2enmod headers

# for SSL
sudo a2enmod ssl
```

TITLE: Opening Stash Database with sqlite3
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to open the Stash sqlite3 database file using the sqlite3 client from the command line. It first changes the directory to the Stash configuration directory and then opens the database file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/manually-editing-the-stash-sqlite3-database.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash

```
cd ~/.stash
sqlite3 stash-go.sqlite
```

TITLE: Subtag Explorer (CSS)
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet extends the alternative tag layout to create a subtag explorer, designed for hierarchical tag structures. It displays a (...) icon for tags with subtags, allowing users to navigate the subtag hierarchy by clicking the tag name while clicking the image opens the tag normally. It requires the previous tag layout changes CSS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/themes/custom-css-snippets.md#_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
/*Tag layout changes*/
	.tag-card {
		width: 16rem;
		padding: 0;
	}

	.tag-card .card-section {
		height: 2.5rem;
		position: absolute;
		bottom: 0;
		left: 0;
		right: 0;
		background: #0000007a;
		line-height: none;
	}
	.tag-card .card-section .TruncatedText {
		-webkit-line-clamp: 1 !important;
	}
	.tag-card h1,
	h2,
	h3,
	h4,
	h5,
	h6,
	.h1,
	.h2,
	.h3,
	.h4,
	.h5,
	.h6 {
		line-height: normal;
	}
	.tag-card hr,
	.tag-description {
		display: none;
	}
	.tag-card .btn-group {
		position: absolute;
		width: 100%;
		bottom: 2.5rem;
		margin-bottom: 0;
		opacity: 0;
		transition: ease 0.2s;
	}
	.tag-card .btn-group:hover {
		opacity: 1;
		transition: ease 0.2s;
		background: #0000007a;
	}

	.tag-card-image {
		object-fit: cover;
		object-position: center;
	}

	.zoom-0 .tag-card-image {
		max-height: none;
		height: 16rem;
		width: 12rem;
	}

	.zoom-1 .tag-card-image {
		max-height: none;
		height: 20rem;
		width: 15rem;
	}

	.zoom-2 .tag-card-image {
		max-height: none;
		height: 24rem;
		width: 18rem;
	}

	.zoom-3 .tag-card-image {
		max-height: none;
		height: 28rem;
		width: 21rem;
	}

	.zoom-0.tag-card,
	.zoom-1.tag-card,
	.zoom-2.tag-card,
	.zoom-3.tag-card {
		width: initial;
	}

	.tag-card .card-section > a {
		position: absolute;
		width: 100%;
		height: 100%;
		display: block;
		left: 0;
		right: 0;
		top: 0;
		bottom: 0;
		padding: 7px 14px 0px 14px;
	}
	.tag-card .card-section .tag-sub-tags {
		position: relative;
		margin-top: 2rem;
		z-index: 1;
	}
	.tag-sub-tags {
		font-size: 0;
	}
	.tag-parent-tags {
		display: none;
	}
	/*Tag subtag exploration snipset*/
	.tag-card .card-section > a {
		cursor: default;
		pointer-events: none;
	}
	.tag-card .card-section > hr {
		margin-top: 2rem;
	}
	.tag-card .card-section .tag-sub-tags {
		position: absolute !important;
		margin-top: 0 !important;
		width: 100%;
		height: 100%;
		display: block;
		left: 0;
		right: 0;
		top: 0;
		bottom: 0;
		padding: 0;
	}
	.tag-sub-tags::before {
		content: "";
		display: block;
		background: url("https://img.icons8.com/material-outlined/24/137cbd/connection-status-off.png")
			no-repeat;
		background-size: 1.5rem 1.5rem;
		width: 1.5rem;
		height: 1.5rem;
		float: right;
		margin: 0.5rem 0.5rem 0 0;
	}
	.tag-sub-tags > a {
		width: 100%;
		height: 100%;
		display: block;
	}

	.tag-card .btn-group a {
		z-index: 10;
	}
	.tag-sub-tags {
		font-size: 0;
	}
	.tag-parent-tags {
		display: none;
	}
```

TITLE: Deleting All Tags in Stash Database
DESCRIPTION: This SQL snippet demonstrates how to delete all tags from the Stash database. It executes two SQL DELETE statements: one to remove entries from the `scenes_tags` table (the join table between scenes and tags) and another to remove entries from the `tags` table itself. Note this will not work if you have Scene marker tags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/manually-editing-the-stash-sqlite3-database.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
sqlite> DELETE FROM scenes_tags;
sqlite> DELETE FROM tags;
```

TITLE: Blur NSFW Images with CSS
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet applies a blur effect to NSFW images and text in the Stash UI.  It uses the 'filter: blur()' property to obfuscate content within specific CSS classes. The goal is to provide a less explicit view when working with NSFW content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/themes/custom-css-snippets.md#_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
/* [Global changes] Blur NSFW images */

.scene-card-preview-video,
.scene-card-preview-image,
.image-card-preview-image,
.image-thumbnail,
.gallery-card-image,
.performer-card-image,
.tag-card-image,
img.performer,
.group-card-image,
.gallery .flexbin img,
.wall-item-media,
.scene-studio-overlay .image-thumbnail,
.image-card-preview-image,
#scene-details-container .text-input,
#scene-details-container .scene-header,
#scene-details-container .react-select__single-value,
.scene-details .pre,
#scene-tabs-tabpane-scene-file-info-panel span.col-8.text-truncate > a,
.gallery .flexbin img,
.group-details .logo {
	filter: blur(12px);
}

.scene-card-video {
	filter: blur(13px);
}

.jw-video,
.jw-preview,
.jw-flag-floating,
.image-container,
.studio-logo,
.scene-cover {
	filter: blur(20px);
}

.group-card .text-truncate,
.scene-card .card-section {
	filter: blur(4px);
}
```

TITLE: Blur and Unblur NSFW Images on Hover CSS
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet blurs NSFW images by default and unblurs them on mouse hover. It uses different blur levels for initial obfuscation and hover interaction, enhancing user privacy while allowing detailed viewing when desired.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/themes/custom-css-snippets.md#_snippet_31

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
/* [Global changes] Blur NSFW images and unblur on mouse over */
/* === MORE BLUR === */
/* scene */
.scene-card-preview,
.vjs-poster,
video,
.scene-cover,
.scrubber-item,

/* image */
.image-card-preview,
.image-image,
.gallery-image,

/* group */
.group-card-image,
.group-images,

/* gallery */
.gallery-card-image,
 table > tbody > tr > td > a > img.w-100,

/* performer */
.performer-card-image,
img.performer,

/* studio */
.studio-card-image,

/* tag */
.tag-card-image

{
	filter: blur(30px);
}

/* === LESS BLUR === */
/* common */
.card-section-title,

/* scene */
.scene-studio-overlay,
.scene-header > h3,
h3.scene-header,
.studio-logo,
.image-thumbnail,

/* image */
h3.image-header,

/* group */
.group-details > div > h2,

/* gallery */
h3.gallery-header,

/* studio */
.studio-details .logo,
.studio-details > div > h2,

/* tag */
.logo-container > .logo,
.logo-container > h2

{
	filter: blur(2px);
}

/* === UNBLUR ON HOVER === */
/* common */
.thumbnail-section:hover *,
.card:hover .card-section-title,

/* scene */
.card:hover .scene-studio-overlay,
.video-js:hover .vjs-poster,
video:hover,
.scene-header:hover > h3,
div:hover > .scene-header,
.studio-logo:hover,
.scene-cover:hover,
.image-thumbnail:hover,
.scene-card-preview:hover,
.scrubber-item:hover,

/* image */
.image-image:hover,
div:hover > .image-header,
.gallery-image:hover,

/* group */
.group-images:hover,
.group-details > div > h2:hover,

/* gallery */
div:hover > .gallery-header,
table > tbody > tr > td:hover > a > img.w-100,

/* performer */
img.performer:hover,

/* studio */ 
.studio-details .logo:hover,
.studio-details:hover > div > h2,

/* tag */
.logo-container > .logo:hover,
.logo-container:hover > h2
{
	filter: blur(0px);
}
```

TITLE: Nginx Proxy Upgrade Headers (Websockets)
DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet is used in conjunction with the `proxy.conf` file within the Letencrypt Unraid docker container to resolve 422 errors.  It specifically enables websocket support by setting the appropriate headers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/guides/reverse-proxy.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```

TITLE: Generating SSL Certificate and Key using OpenSSL
DESCRIPTION: This command generates an SSL certificate and key for Stash using OpenSSL. It requires customization to fit the specific environment, including setting the subject alternative name (SAN) to match the server's domain or IP address. The certificate and key files (stash.crt and stash.key) must be placed in the same directory as the config.yml file or the ~/.stash directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/faq/setup.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
openssl req -x509 -newkey rsa:4096 -sha256 -days 7300 -nodes -keyout stash.key -out stash.crt -extensions san -config <(echo "[req]"; echo distinguished_name=req; echo "[san]"; echo subjectAltName=DNS:stash.server,IP:127.0.0.1) -subj /CN=stash.server
```

TITLE: Different Tag Cards Layout (CSS)
DESCRIPTION: This CSS modifies the layout of tag cards by hiding parent and sub-tags, adjusting card sections, and implementing hover effects. It creates a visually distinct tag card appearance with interactive elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/themes/custom-css-snippets.md#_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
/* [Tags changes] changes the layout of tag cards on tags page and hover */
	.tag-parent-tags, .tag-sub-tags { display: none;}
	.tag-card.zoom-0.grid-card.card div.card-section div.card-popovers.btn-group { margin-top: 1em; }
	.tag-card.zoom-0.grid-card.card div.thumbnail-section a.tag-card-header img.tag-card-image { object-fit: cover; }
	.tag-card.zoom-0.grid-card.card div.card-section hr { display: none; }
	
	.tag-card.zoom-0.grid-card.card {
		padding: 0;
		width: 300px;
		height: 180px;
	}
	
	.tag-card.zoom-0.grid-card.card div.card-section {
		position: absolute;
		text-shadow: 2px 2px 2px #000;
		width: 100%;
		background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
		height: 3em;
		overflow: hidden;
		transition: 0.8s ease-in-out;
	}
	
	.tag-card.zoom-0.grid-card.card div.card-section a {
		text-decoration: none;
	}
	
	.tag-card.zoom-0.grid-card.card div.card-section:hover {
		height: 22em;
	}
	
	.tag-card.zoom-0.grid-card.card 
		div.card-section a 
		h5.card-section-title.flex-aligned 
		div.TruncatedText {
		white-space: nowrap;
		text-overflow: ellipsis;
		width: 300px;
		overflow: hidden;
		display: block;
	}
	
	.tag-card.zoom-0.grid-card.card div.card-section div.TruncatedText.tag-description {
		position: relative;
		top: 0.5em;
		-webkit-text-stroke-width: 1px;
		font-size: 16px;
	}
	
	.tag-card .card-popovers .btn {
		text-shadow: 1px 1px 1px #000;
		stroke: black;
		stroke-width: 15;
	}
```

TITLE: Swapping Studio and Resolution Positions - CSS
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet swaps the positions of the studio and resolution/duration information on scene cards. It adjusts the bottom, right, height, and top properties of both '.scene-studio-overlay' and '.scene-specs-overlay' classes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/themes/custom-css-snippets.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
/* [Scenes tab] Swap studio and resolution/duration positions */

.scene-studio-overlay {
	bottom: 1rem;
	right: 0.7rem;
	height: inherit;
	top: inherit;
	}

.scene-specs-overlay {
	right: 0.7rem;
	top: 0.7rem;
	bottom: inherit;
	}
```

TITLE: Hiding Lightbox Header and Footer - CSS
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet hides the lightbox header and footer to enlarge the image area. Mouse movement reveals them as an overlay. It modifies z-index, position, width, opacity, background-color, and transition properties of relevant classes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/themes/custom-css-snippets.md#_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
/* [Gallery tab] Hides the lightbox header and footer to make the image area larger. Mouse reveals them as an overlay to the image*/

	.Lightbox-header,
	.Lightbox-footer{
	z-index:9999;
	position:absolute;
	width:100%;
	opacity:0;
	background-color:#0008;
	transition: opacity 0.5s ease;
	}

	.Lightbox-footer{
	bottom:0;}

	.Lightbox-navbutton{
	opacity:0;
	transition: opacity 0.5s ease;
	}


	.Lightbox-navbutton:hover,
	.Lightbox-header:hover,
	.Lightbox-footer:hover{
	opacity:1;
	}
```

TITLE: Alternative Tag Layout (CSS)
DESCRIPTION: This CSS provides an alternative tag layout to display more images and details on hover. It adjusts card dimensions, section heights, and button visibility to create a visually appealing and informative tag card design.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/themes/custom-css-snippets.md#_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
/*Tag layout changes*/
	.tag-card {
		width: 16rem;
		padding: 0;
	}

	.tag-card .card-section {
		height: 2.5rem;
		position: absolute;
		bottom: 0;
		left: 0;
		right: 0;
		background: #0000007a;
		line-height: none;
	}
	.tag-card .card-section .TruncatedText {
		-webkit-line-clamp: 1 !important;
	}
	.tag-card h1,
	h2,
	h3,
	h4,
	h5,
	h6,
	.h1,
	.h2,
	.h3,
	.h4,
	.h5,
	.h6 {
		line-height: normal;
	}
	.tag-card hr,
	.tag-description {
		display: none;
	}
	.tag-card .btn-group {
		position: absolute;
		width: 100%;
		bottom: 2.5rem;
		margin-bottom: 0;
		opacity: 0;
		transition: ease 0.2s;
	}
	.tag-card .btn-group:hover {
		opacity: 1;
		transition: ease 0.2s;
		background: #0000007a;
	}

	.tag-card-image {
		object-fit: cover;
		object-position: center;
	}

	.zoom-0 .tag-card-image {
		max-height: none;
		height: 16rem;
		width: 12rem;
	}

	.zoom-1 .tag-card-image {
		max-height: none;
		height: 20rem;
		width: 15rem;
	}

	.zoom-2 .tag-card-image {
		max-height: none;
		height: 24rem;
		width: 18rem;
	}

	.zoom-3 .tag-card-image {
		max-height: none;
		height: 28rem;
		width: 21rem;
	}

	.zoom-0.tag-card,
	.zoom-1.tag-card,
	.zoom-2.tag-card,
	.zoom-3.tag-card {
		width: initial;
	}

	.tag-card .card-section > a {
		position: absolute;
		width: 100%;
		height: 100%;
		display: block;
		left: 0;
		right: 0;
		top: 0;
		bottom: 0;
		padding: 7px 14px 0px 14px;
	}
	.tag-card .card-section .tag-sub-tags {
		position: relative;
		margin-top: 2rem;
		z-index: 1;
	}
	.tag-sub-tags {
		font-size: 0;
	}
	.tag-parent-tags {
		display: none;
	}
```

CODE:
```

```

TITLE: Setup Python Environment for Stash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up a Python 3.11 environment for Stash scrapers and plugins. It ensures pip is up to date, creates a virtual environment named `stash-env`, activates it, and installs `pipreqs` which generates requirements file from imports.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-docs/blob/main/docs/installation/synology.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python3.11 -m ensurepip --Update
python3.11 -m venv stash-env
source stash-env/bin/activate
pip3 install pipreqs
```
